title: The Hoddle of Coffee : Tottenham Hotspur news and links for Tuesday , May 21
body_text:
good morning!
The Hoddle of Coffee: Tottenham Hotspur news and links for Tuesday, May 21
Trending Up / Down
The season is done and dusted, which means now is the perfect time to have one final Trending Up / Trending Down.
The concept is simple. Hoddle Headquarters takes a look at what around Tottenham Hotspur is trending up, and what is trending down.
Let’s get started.
Trending up
Cristian Romero: Named Spurs’ player of the season and is a new father. This is an easy one. A great couple of weeks for Cuti.
Guglielmo Vicario: He made some truly incredible saves against Manchester City and Sheffield United. One of the better saves of the season came in the 16th minute against City, getting his glove on a shot by Phil Foden from close range. Pierre-Emil Hojbjerg is a lucky man after that botched clearance.
Cup finals: Tottenham Horspur’s women’s squad and the men’s U-21 squad both competed in cup finals these last two weeks. Neither turned out the way we wanted them to, but it’s great to see Spurs back in a Cup final. Here’s to next year.
Ben Davies and Beth England: Both players received Tottenham’s PFA Community Champion awards for being involved in the community for the 2023-24 season. Well done.
Pedro Porro: Two really great strikes in the run-in against Burnely and Sheffield United. Really liked what I saw from him this season and hope there’s more to come in the next.
Trending down
James Maddison: Hasn’t looked like himself for months and I don’t think his place in the England squad is all that guaranteed right now. Hope he plays as little as possible in Australia so he can recover from whatever lingering injury problems he has (if any).
Domestic flights: Tottenham jetted off to Australia soon as the season ended. Really? That’s pretty lame. Give these players at least a week to spend some time with their families before meaningless football season.
Fitzie’s track of the day: Cardinal, by Kasey Musgraves
